intro: Garnotia deflexa, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a herbaceous perennial native to South Africa. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Garnotia deflexa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
